sen.j: 正親町 公明（おおぎまち きんあき、延享元年3月25日 (旧暦)（1744年5月7日） - 文化 (元号)10年10月13日 (旧暦)（1813年11月5日））は、江戸時代後期の公家。
sen.e: Kinaki OOGIMACHI (May 7, 1744-November 5, 1813) was a kuge (court noble) in the late Edo Period.
Kinaki OGIMACHI (May 7, 1744-November 5, 1813) was kuge (a court noble) in the late Edo Period.
sen.cmt: oを一つ削除、冠詞の位置変更しました。
sen.e: Kinaki OGIMACHI (May 7, 1744-November 5, 1813) was kuge (a court noble) in the late Edo Period.
His father was Sanetsura OOGIMACHI.
His father was Sanetsura OGIMACHI.
His father was Sanetsura OGIMACHI.

sen.j: 母は内大臣広幡豊忠の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Toyotada HIROHATA, a naidaijin (minister of the center).
His mother was a daughter of Toyotada HIROHATA, naidaijin (minister of the center).
His mother was a daughter of Toyotada HIROHATA, naidaijin (minister of the center).
He first named 公功.
sen.cmt: 公功の読みが不明です。
sen.e: He was originally named 公功.
He was originally named 公功.

sen.j: 1765年（明和2年）蔵人頭、1768年（明和5年）参議、1779年（安永8年）大納言に至る。
sen.e: He became a Kurodo no to (head chamberlain) in 1765, Sangi (councilor) in 1768, and Dainagon (a chief councilor of state) in 1779.
He became Kurodo no to (head chamberlain) in 1765, Sangi (councilor) in 1768, and Dainagon (a chief councilor of state) in 1779.
He became Kurodo no to (head chamberlain) in 1765, Sangi (councilor) in 1768, and Dainagon (a chief councilor of state) in 1779.

sen.j: 翌1780年（安永9年）から院評定衆・院伝奏を歴任。
sen.e: From the following year, 1780, he successively held the posts of In no hyojoshu (the Retired Emperors judicial council) and Indenso (job title to relay messages of court people to the retired emperor).

From the following year, 1780, he successively held the posts of In no hyojoshu (the retired emperors judicial council) and Indenso (job title to relay messages of court people to the retired emperor).
sen.cmt: 用語統一のため小文字化しました。
sen.e: From the following year, 1780, he successively held the posts of In no hyojoshu (the retired emperors judicial council) and Indenso (job title to relay messages of court people to the retired emperor).

sen.j: 1791年（寛政3年）から武家伝奏となる。
sen.e: He became a Buke tenso (liaison officers between the imperial court and the samurai family) in 1791.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He became Buke tenso (a liaison officer between the imperial court and the samurai family) in 1791.
sen.cmt: 冠詞の位置変更、単数化しました。
sen.e: He became Buke tenso (a liaison officer between the imperial court and the samurai family) in 1791.

sen.j: しかし、翌1792年（寛政4年）尊号一件（光格天皇が実父典仁親王に太上天皇号を贈ろうとしたが幕府に拒否された事件）の責任をたらされて職を免じられた。
sen.e: In the following year, 1792, however, he resigned his post to take responsibility for Songo ikken (Songo Incident; incident that Emperor Kokaku tried to give Imperial Prince Sukehito, the Emperor's natural father, a daijo-tenno-go [name of the retired emperor], but bakufu [Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun] denied that).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the following year, 1792, however, he was expelld from his post to take responsibility for Songo ikken (Songo Incident; incident that Emperor Kokaku tried to give Imperial Prince Sukehito: the Emperor's natural father, daijo-tenno-go [name of the retired emperor], but bakufu [Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun] denied that).
sen.cmt: 退職ではなく免職に変更しました。わかりやすいようコンマをコロンに変更しました。
sen.e: In the following year, 1792, however, he was expelld from his post to take responsibility for Songo ikken (Songo Incident; incident that Emperor Kokaku tried to give Imperial Prince Sukehito: the Emperor's natural father, daijo-tenno-go [name of the retired emperor], but bakufu [Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun] denied that).

sen.j: 1803年（享和3年）後桜町天皇の院別当を辞して、出家し竟空と号した。
sen.e: In 1803, he left service of Emperor Gosakuramachi's In no betto (chief administrator of the Retired Emperor's Office), entered the priesthood, and called himself 竟空.
sen.cmt: 竟空の読みが不明です。
sen.e: In 1803, he left service of Emperor Gosakuramachi's In no betto (chief administrator of the Retired Emperor's Office), entered the priesthood, and called himself 竟空.
In 1803, he left service of Emperor Gosakuramachi's In no betto (chief administrator of the Retired Emperor's Office), entered the priesthood, and called himself 竟空.
